instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A PFM006 PPN001 error code
threads.message: So I have here this macbook pro 15" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> which produces this error codes in the diagnose mode. The fans are spinning high and the macbook is very slow. What I read about this error, that changing the touch pad will solve this. So I put this mainboard in an second functional macbook and the error is exactly the same. I have installed the TG Pro software and I'm missing the point "palm rest". It looks like there is a failure on the mainboard not on the externals. Any solution for this? Does it make sense to change the smc or is it possible to change this? I don't know maybe it is locked with a serial number or so. Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A PFM006 PPN001 error code
threads.message:
SMC functions are included in T2; so no way to change SMC.

Any history available?
Did you use different trackpad flex for test in the other shell?
Also, battery was different too?

Test with external monitor, disconnecting internal LCD.
This way you can discard an ALS failure.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A PFM006 PPN001 error code
threads.message: Thanks for replay. There is no really history, over night this error appeared. Nothing special, no water, no drop. I changed the board 1:1 in other shell so battery, display touch pad and all other things were different. Today I have disconnected the display and conected to external monitor. Same issue. By the way what is ALS failure?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A PFM006 PPN001 error code
threads.message:
Ambient Light Sensor (when fails) is known to cause weird issues to various thermal sensors.

If trackpad and ALS have been discarded, check SMC I2C "2" S0 bus (page 51); diode mode to ground and voltage.
Inspect all chips and adjacent components involved on this bus.
Also check <CHIP>U6861</CHIP> and related resistors.
